key_title: Key to the genera of Araceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons

leads.lead_text: Terrestrial herbs, rarely free-floating aquatics; leaves alternate, usually basal; inflorescence on thickened axis, subtended and ± covered by a large coloured bract
Free-floating aquatics; leaves absent, plants consisting of a leaf-like thallus; flowers seldom seen, reproduction largely vegetative,  with new thalli produced from a small slit or budding pouch
Herbs to 1.5 m tall; leaves green, venation radiating from apex, without submarginal vein; inflorescence axis fertile to apex, bract white

Herbs to 0.5 m tall, leaves variegated or with grey spots, venation reticulate, with prominent submarginal vein; inflorescence axis terminating with a sterile appendix, bract green, brownish or purple
Bract 11–30 cm long, pale green, not striped, margins overlapping at base, never connate; leaf venation white
Bract 4–8.5 cm long, brownish green to purple at apex, white at base with dark longitudinal stripes, margins connate for most of their length; leaf venation green
Roots present (absent in Lemna trisulca) and thallus ± flattened
Roots absent and thallus ± globular, ellipsoid or ovoid
Roots 0 or 1 per thallus; thallus with 1–3, often indistinct veins; base of thallus without a scale
Roots (1–) 2–18; thallus with 3–15, often indistinct veins; base of thallus with a scale covering the point of attachement of the roots
